title: Comparative Analysis of Online Education Transition Experiences: Applying a Social Constructivist Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in executing high-level projects
context.additional_context: Social studies-linked course for working professionals, formative assessment-centered. Emphasis on learning through social interaction in smartphone-based limited-technology environments.

learning_goals: Learners can explain social constructivist-based learning designs in blended online-offline environments.
Learners can propose at least three strategies for forming online learning communities through asynchronous communication (messenger discussions) with peers.
Learners can practice and evaluate at least two methods to enhance tutor-learner interaction using smartphone-based tools.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
